node.title: Meet Gordon, the loyal cat who ratted out a tiger snake
node.description: A Dartmoor man urges residents in southern Victoria and South Australia to be vigilant after his cat found a deadly snake hidingÂ among shopping bags in his kitchen.
node.content:
["South West Victorian resident Ricky Owens says he will think twice when picking up shopping bags in his kitchen after a surprise encounter with a one-metre-long venomous tiger snake.\u00a0", "Mr Owens says he left the internal door to his Dartmoor home open when he went out, and suspects\u00a0the reptile slithered\u00a0through\u00a0a gap in his flyscreen door.", "\"I'd been out of the house for a couple of hours,\" Mr Owens\u00a0said.", "\"When I came back, I just sat down and noticed my old cat\u00a0Gordon was banging around one of the lounge chairs, hissing and scratching and then jumping back.\"", "Mr Owens lifted the lounge chair but did not find anything and thought\u00a0\"no more of it\" before heading to the pub.", "", "
A tiger snake slithers across Ricky Owen's kitchen floor.\u00a0(Supplied: Ricky Owens)
", "When he returned home, Gordon\u00a0continued to act out of character.", "\"I was getting some tea out of the fridge and the cat was again scratching\u00a0among\u00a0a couple of shopping bags I had sitting beside the fridge,\" he\u00a0said.", "Mr Owens said he\u00a0picked up the shopping bags.", "Mr Owens said the snake\u00a0tried\u00a0to hide underneath the fridge.", "\"All I had was about six inches of the belly of [the snake]\u00a0hanging out from under the fridge,\" he said.", "Mr Owens said\u00a0he pulled the snake out from underneath the fridge and threw it over his back fence.", "While\u00a0joking\u00a0about the incident, he said\u00a0there were\u00a0some serious lessons to be learnt.", "", "
Gordon the cat discovers a deadly tiger snake near the fridge inside a Dartmoor house.(Supplied: Ricky Owens)
", "\"If my cat hadn't played up \u2026 I'd be none the wiser.", "\"Just imagine you're a little kid who\u00a0wants to reach into those bags and go, 'What's this thing?'\u00a0Anything can happen.\"", "
Snake catcher predicts busy summer
", "Mount Gambier snake catcher and educator David Miles said it was not unusual to find snakes in homes and warned people not to leave their doors open.\u00a0", "\"I have been called out to a house at Kongorong where a snake was in a bedroom,\" Mr Miles said.", "", "
Tiger snakes are among the\u00a0most venomous snakes\u00a0in the world.(ABC South East SA: Sandra Morello)
", "Mr Miles \u2014\u00a0who survived a tiger snake bite late last year \u2014\u00a0said snakes searched for water or cool spots during warm days.", "\"I have heard of snakes doing laps of houses to try and get in,\" Mr Miles said.", "He said if a snake is detected inside a home, it was important to try to\u00a0contain it to one area so it could be located.", "\"People can put tape along a bottom of a door or even stuff towels there to stop snakes moving,\" Mr Miles said.", "He warned the warmer weather would trigger a rise in snake sightings across the region.", "Mr Miles said he recently removed a venomous copperhead from a Mount Gambier motel.", "\"I think it is going to be a full-on year for snakes. But we must remember they are part of nature, and we have to put up with\u00a0them,\" he said."]
